website_summaries.verdict: Eliminate those harmful clay dust clouds with this biodegradable, grass alternative.
pros: Natural grass litter forms hard, solid clumps
Soft, sand-like texture is gentle on cat’s paws, especially those without their claws
cons: Litter sits at a slightly higher price point than it's competitors

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed after months of great quality...
customer_reviews.text: We used this litter for several months after finally finding a great, natural, clumping litter with odor control for a 3 cat household. Unfortunately, our last shipment the bag was INFESTED with little bugs. Our cats have been going crazy trying to catch them and we have been going crazy trying to figure out how to get rid of them. I am SO disappointed that this is the quality they allow to get to customers, the hassle this is causing us is not worth ever purchasing this litter again and taking the chance. We will never purchase this litter again.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: Bugs!
customer_reviews.text: I actually love this product as a cat litter. I buy it at my local pet supply sometimes. This time, however, I bought it from Amazon, and it was infested with pantry beetles, which my pest control guy told me can get into your pantry and eat everything. He also told me that he's had other customers who bought pet products from Amazon and received them infested with the same beetles. I'm not sure if this is a problem at the manufacturer or at the Amazon warehouse, but, YUCK.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Tracked all over the place
customer_reviews.text: First off, I love the idea of eco-friendly litter. Sadly, this isn't the one to use. This litter ended up getting tracked all over the house. Everywhere. After switching away from it a month ago, I'm still vacuuming it up. Way too messy. To me, the whole point of "dust free" litter is that the litter box area stays cleaner, easier to maintain. But with this kind getting tracked all over the house, the dust-free part doesn't matter, since the litter itself ends up all over.
customer_reviews.author: rkp1

customer_reviews.title: One and done
customer_reviews.text: This is a horribly tracking litter, as referenced in my photo. My oldest won't use the top entry as he is a senior, otherwise I guess it would be decent. I was using clumping silica crystals which I love but my oldest cat was allergic to the clumping agent. I don't find odor management to be stellar with this one, as advertised. The search continues
customer_reviews.author: Lragone78

customer_reviews.title: BUGS
customer_reviews.text: I have always loved this litter; nothing clumps like it, no little broken off bits that are impossible to get out, very little dust, very light-weight (which is important since I can't carry heavy things). Just wanted to post that I didn't find any bugs or beetles in the litter. It's exactly as what I've bought in stores. edited: BUGS. and since I've used half the bag, I can't return it. This is clearly a problem with the seller, not the product b/c I've used this litter for years without this problem. I will be getting my litter from the pet store from now on. Luckily, it's light so that's not difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Cerys

customer_reviews.title: Poor clumping and worse odors!
customer_reviews.text: This litter doesn’t clump as well as the video shows and makes odors worse. I’ve been using another grass litter: Fresh 4 life eco clump, not sold by amazon, which is a lot better than this litter, but I wanted to try it based on most positive reviews. After almost a week, it didn’t work and I’ll not purchase it again. I’ll go back to Fresh 4 Life and hopefully, Amazon will start selling it soon.
customer_reviews.author: Jamella_B

customer_reviews.title: Pesticides!!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this product until I heard about their definition of "chemical-free" -- what they don't say is that the product is treated with pesticides and herbicides. Hardly all-natural, and very well might cause serious issues years after starting use.
customer_reviews.author: PawPrints

customer_reviews.title: Love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: I wrote my original review too soon. This stuff is garbage. It clumps well, I will give it that, but only for a short period of time. The smell, though, is terrible. You basically have to clean it at least 1-2x per day, and even then it's only good for about a week, and you have to replace the entire litter. I am the first person to go after the all natural product. But when it's like this, no thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Krystian Ciolek

customer_reviews.title: Our 6 cats give it a 5 star rating!
customer_reviews.text: Finally after dealing with cat litters that don't do what they say they will do someone came up with something that is truly miraculous. I have a multiple cat household, to be more specific 6. All of them use the litter boxes with the exception to one that likes going outdoors. The two bags I order lasted me a little over one week. No odor and I only had to remove the urine and feces. The way this gels up, I have never seen anything like it. The rest of the litter stays clean and odor free and guess what, so does the litter box. Ordering some more today. Thank you to whoever invented this stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Luna

customer_reviews.title: JUST WATCH THE PRODUCT VIDEO
customer_reviews.text: First, go watch the product video. And yes, it really clumps like that! There is little to no dust, no chemicals, and I don't have any worries about it being safe for my animals if they do lick it off. But frankly, this doesn't stick in their fur like clay either. All around, it's the best litter I've ever used, and I think I've tried them all. Caveat: it tracks. So yes, you'll have to sweep. But I use the SmartCat litter pad/rug and that helps a ton. But I still sweep litter. As far as I'm concerned, it's a small thing to deal with when scooping is SO EASY--it takes a fraction of the time to clean the box.
customer_reviews.author: NorthernGirl5

customer_reviews.title: Avoid
customer_reviews.text: This litter is so sticky that it sticks to the pan after clumping. It also sticks to my cats paws all over every time they are done. The odor mixed with cat waste is even worse than the waste itself. It tracks all over the house. It’s none stop daily cleaning the floor and my cats paws.
customer_reviews.author: blair

customer_reviews.title: Great with pros/cons
customer_reviews.text: This is excellent cat litter. It is natural, super absorbing, and 100% dust free (seriously). The downsides are that it is tracking - it sticks to cats feet and they carry it out of the box a bit more that clay litter (so you just need to sweep a bit more) and it is so odorless (that is a great thing) that your older cat may not recognize the box as a place to pee because it doesn't smell like a catbox.
customer_reviews.author: SSB

customer_reviews.title: Much healthier than clay litter!
customer_reviews.text: Have always used clay litter and dealt with the dust. Sweeping & dusting every day, vacuuming every three days. After two years of me having breathing challenges without any idea why it started, noticed my cat having some small breathing problems. Couldn't figure out why & on a whim decided to research litters & if the dust could be having an impact. Super long story short - after changing to this litter it's like magic! My breathing problems have gone away and my cat's too! This litter does track all over moderately, but with me, it's a very small price to pay for better health.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Tracks
customer_reviews.text: I really like this litter in general. Love the tech. However it tracks everywhere,I'm sweeping profusely. I also bought a cat mat to catch the litter and to no avail an XX-LARGE one as well. I will finish out the bag but will continue the search. If your buying this maybe have 3 mats in front your litter box.
customer_reviews.author: AyoC

customer_reviews.title: No Smell and Clumps Perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: Quality surpassed my expectations! Worth the price! One 20 lb bag lasted over 2 months for 2 cats because clumping was so good (unlike clay clumping litter which always breaks down and gets spread all throughout the clean litter making one big smelly mess). Also, box is cleaner because clumps don't stick to sides of box. No smell either! So happy to never use clay litter again EVER!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Cook

customer_reviews.title: Cats can be so picky!
customer_reviews.text: I've been experimenting with litter to try and find something better for my cat and me. Tried this and boy oh boy did he not like this! All I did was add a little to the box and he didn't want to use the box anymore till I buried it far down and covered it with what he was used to. Other litters? No problem introducing slowly. Not sure what it was about it that he didn't like though! Didn't have a horrible smell or texture to me. I'll try it again in time since I have this bag of it. So funny how he disliked the most expensive litter I've ever bought lol
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Clumps well for cats with kidney disease!
customer_reviews.text: Clumps better than any other litter I’ve tried! My cat has ckd, so she pees a lot. We were using Worlds Best for years because of her allergies, but it doesn’t clump as tight and the potty spreads. I was recommended this and I think we will stick with it! It is so much easier to scoop and makes the litter box much tidier. I haven’t noticed any real scent. I haven’t noticed any difference in litter box odor either.
customer_reviews.author: Kara F.

customer_reviews.title: Way better than standard litter
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is leaps ahead of clay based litters. Aside from the lack of both dust and smell this stuff sets like concrete, makes for less scooping. As others have noted it does get everywhere, so a extra large catch mat is needed or keeping it on a hard surface. Being really lightweight it means you get a lot more for less, a 10lb bag is a similar amount of litter to 20lb of the usual clay based litters. If you wanna keep the already lower smell down to almost nothing get yourself a small bag of cat litter crystals to mix in, almost can't smell the litter box when I'm in the same room.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Brown

customer_reviews.title: Cool product but tracks too much
customer_reviews.text: The cat shelter I volunteer at uses this litter - it's made entirely from grass and is thus a totally green product, which is awesome! - so I got some to try at home with my cat. I'd liked the smell at the cat shelter - mostly it smells like grass! - whereas I don't love the smell of clay litter. However, my cat ended up tracking this litter around the apartment WAY more than her old clay litter. We live in tight quarters, so litter tracking is a big factor for us when buying litter, so unfortunately this isn't going to be a permanent change for us. I wish we could use it!
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: 99.9% NO Dust
customer_reviews.text: First off, my kitty refuses to use the paper kitty litter. The only time I ever notice any dust what so ever is if I just poured a ton of new litter into the litter box. Otherwise you never smell litter dust. In fact, since I change from the clumping-clay litter... there is a profound difference in the overall air quality in the room. I have tried countless Clay litters claiming 99% dust free... and frankly.. they cannot compete with this kitty litter. No dust especially important because my kitty has chronic sinus issues due to a tumor growing in his sinus so he doesn't need anything that's going to exasperate his condition.
customer_reviews.author: Teri

customer_reviews.title: Drove me crazy cleaning up constantly
customer_reviews.text: This litter drove me bananas - it's so light of weight that it tracked everywhere. And I mean everywhere. I was finding this litter in my upstairs bed and bath room! And in my bed! It must have been sticking to the cat. Constantly had me cleaning up. The smell - hard to describe but it did smell. Probably a fresh scent is accurate but it does nothing to cover the smell of the cat's business... Combined it wasn't pleasant I felt. It's not dust free - it's better than most, but not totally dust free. This is not for me.
customer_reviews.author: CindyBig

customer_reviews.title: Zero odor, great clumping, natural.
customer_reviews.text: Admittedly, my cat isn’t picky about his litter. I like this litter because it’s natural but clumps very well which makes daily scooping super easy. With daily scooping and a topper-off of another 1” of litter after 1 week or so, I only need to fully change his box every 2-3 weeks and there is NO ODOR. We’ve had multiple visitors to our small apartment who’ve complimented us on the fact that our apartment has ZERO ‘cat smell’ (read: litter box odor) despite its small dimensions.
customer_reviews.author: Meredith B.

customer_reviews.title: many dead small beatles in product
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying this product for several years. The last shipment had many dead, small beetles mixed in the litter. YUCK! I won't be buying this product from amazon again.
customer_reviews.author: twinkert

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: This is the best natural litter I have found yet. I have tried pellets which where a horrible mistake even with the special pan. This litter really does clump very hard. No matter how hard I sift the scoop it doesn't break apart. It smells nice but right after the cat potties you do smell it and then it soaks up the smell. I really just don't think this will be avoidable without the harsh chemicals that big conventional brands use. I haven't tried it in compost (for ornamental flowers and plants) yet because I haven't completed my research on what grasses and fibers used.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Latiolais

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny. So easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to scoop. Sooooo much better than regular cheap litter I suffered with for YEARS. You definitely get what you pay for, and this is worth every penny. It does stick to my cats paws and track outside the box when they jump out. To remedy this, I bought a covered box and faced it towards a corner to contain the initial radius of mess.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Morris

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Litter
customer_reviews.text: I have tried 20-30 litters( grass, corn, clay, wheat, tofu, breeze pellets, and pine), including popular brands like World's Best. This is my favorite litter, and my cats favorite litter. I have 4 cats and foster cats and kittens as well. Feral kiitens adapt to this litter instantly, and my other cats were instantly drawn to it. It clumps fast. It doesn't let the pee hit the bottom, as long as you keep it the right depth. I use it in deep litter boxes, so tracking isn't a real issue.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: sadly, it tracks everywhere
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this litter twice and wrote a five-star review. Unhappily I am having to add an update. I do love this litter, it clumps like crazy, controls odors, lasts for a month easily, cats seemed to like it just fine. But, unfortunately, it tracks all over the house. I even bought a couple of bathroom rugs placing them just outside litter boxes to catch the litter. I had to keep shaking out the mats multiple times a day and the litter was still covering the hallway and most of downstairs, paths of it. I went back to clay litter. I am not happy about it, but I can't be cleaning the floors every time cats use their box.
customer_reviews.author: Bunny's mom

customer_reviews.title: Clumps very well, much easier to remove unbroken than clay.
customer_reviews.text: I wish both my cats would use this but one is scared of anything new. It actually smells nice and I like the way it clumps much better than the clay. Also, oddly, rabbits will eat this if they get past the baby gate into the back of house, which is probably not good for them .
customer_reviews.author: Steph F

customer_reviews.title: Like the fact that it is not made of food ...
customer_reviews.text: Very light, absorbent and hard clumping, not dusty. Like the fact that it is not made of food material ( corn) and made from natural, biodegradable material. Only objection is that it is does not do much to control odor. Lightweight yes, clumping well yes, no to little smell - absolutely NOT true - can't stand the smell that develops very quickly and LINGERS, also tracks like crazy. all in all I do not understand the rave reviews. Wish somebody could come up with an all around good litter product!
customer_reviews.author: Toodles

customer_reviews.title: This is great cat litter which I will continue to buy again ...
customer_reviews.text: This is great cat litter which I will continue to buy again and again. Before this I was using Tidy Cats which I hated the smell of the litter by itself, litter once cat poop/pee was in it, and the dust. I actually like the smell of this litter, it covers odors very well, and has no dust! Both this litter and the other litter I used before gets tracked around because it is lightweight but at least with this I don't feel like as many nasty chemicals are getting all over my house. Sweep and vacuum it up and it's gone. I also really appreciate that this is compostible so I am putting less waste into the landfills.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Good texture, clumping and odor control needs improvement
customer_reviews.text: My 2 cats seem to prefer this over “World’s Best” slightly, perhaps due to it softer texture. However, this doesn’t clump as well (which isn’t too big a deal for me, I don’t mind scraping a bit at the bottom) as the corn one(worlds best) and has superior odor control (although not too bad already). Since I use a open litter box in my bedroom, odor control is a high high priority for me, thus I don’t think I will repurchase this. I would prefer this over worlds best if this has comparable odor control properties since I dislike world’s best’s corn smell...
customer_reviews.author: Demi

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love this clumping litter! Smells like rice! My kitty's previous litter fresh step had such so much dust it made me sneeze everytime I poured it out. So I switched to something less dusty and better for her lungs. It definitely tracks but I always vaccuum, so no issue here.
customer_reviews.author: Va Tina Kong

customer_reviews.title: So much better than any of the stuff at the grocery / big box stores... amazing odor control and no clay dust to inhale.
customer_reviews.text: I feel a bit odd about writing a review of cat litter of all things, but this stuff is so much better than the stuff we used to buy at Costco or the supermarket. There is none of that super nasty clay powder that rises up into your face when you pour it into the litter box - this stuff actually smells pretty good. It is also far superior in odor control for all the leavings of our kitties. While this is not the cheapest stuff on the market, it makes having to endure a litter box in the house much more bearable than the other stuff. I highly recommend the SmartCat litter.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: But my cat prefers the clay type
customer_reviews.text: I loved this litter but I ran out and used a clay type I had in one litter box and left this in the other box. He immediately stopped using this one because it sticks to his feet (I know because I asked him - kidding- I watched him) and went straight to the clay litter that is big enough it doesn't stick between his toes! It's getting really expensive to buy ANY brand of cat litter during this price-gouging Covid-19 era.
customer_reviews.author: P. Engstrom

customer_reviews.title: Clumps great and less odor than other litters.
customer_reviews.text: I have had kitties for years. This is one of my favorite litters. It clumps great and has less odor. I dont like clay litters as they are dusty. Yes, it tracks. ALL LITTERS TRACK. I purchased great litter mat from Amazon. I also LOVE LOVE LOVE the Litter Genie. This liter and the Genie and you are set. I have prob. tried most litters as I live in a condo. I dont have luxury of mulitiple boxes or a garage box. Again this litter is fabulous and so is Litter Genie!!
customer_reviews.author: KAZ

customer_reviews.title: My Cat eats this litter and got constipated
customer_reviews.text: This litter is not useful because my cat eats it. Pretty gross to see your cat in the literbox eating... We've had to mix 75% other clay litter in with it to finally get the cat to stop eating it. My cat became very constipated and almost needed a visit to the vet. Otherwise the litter clumps well. It does track all over the place. I like that it was all natural, fragrance free and earth friendly, but I can't use this.
customer_reviews.author: Lovie

customer_reviews.title: Love this kitty litter
customer_reviews.text: Love this kitty litter. It is a little more expensive than grocery store brands but well worth the cost. The litter does not cloud the air when you pour it or when you scoop it. It clumps up very nicely and does an amazing job containing odors. The kitties transitioned quickly and easily to it. My favorite part is that I no longer have little trails of grey litter all over the place! I keep a little kitty mat outside of the litter box and the majority of the fine litter particles land there.
customer_reviews.author: PHL to SFO

customer_reviews.title: Best Litter Ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best natural litter on the market! We have tried Swheat Scoop, which was dusty and aggravated my cats wheat allergy, and Blue Buffalo's natural litter made from Hazelnut shells, which doesn't clump well and leaves a nasty brown dust on everything in the room. Smart Cat clumps better than ANY other litter out there, has no artificial scents, NO dust, and lasts longer than other litters because it clumps so well. We have a cat who will pee outside of the cat box if the litter is not fresh enough, and she loves this litter, not a single pee incident in over a month!
customer_reviews.author: Andie Foxglove

customer_reviews.title: Ridiculous tracking
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this to work, but here's my two cents... Pros: -I don't have to worry about the cats ingesting it -clumps fairly well -light weight Cons: -tracks like crrrrrazy and it makes me crazy trying to clean it up constantly -doesn't control odors -smells like a farm (not necessarily a con but when you combine it with cat urine...) -I think it's not great if you have a grass allergy The biggest issue: I just can't stand the constant mess and seeing it on the furniture and whatnot. If messes don't give you anxiety, maybe this will work for you.
customer_reviews.author: flour_girl

customer_reviews.title: The REAL World's Best Cat Litter
customer_reviews.text: I'm never using another litter ever again. Completely odorless for over a week of use. Harder, stronger clumps than anything I've ever used. Kitties love the texture. It tracks out of the box a fair amount, but show me a litter that doesn't and I'll show you a liar. ;-) If I had to complain, I'd say that because the clumps are so perfect, I end up having to replace quite a bit of litter in the box before a full change and cleaning. It does start to smell a teeny bit of urine toward the end of the replace and clean cycle, but I use a baking soda litter deodorizer to get us through the end of it.
customer_reviews.author: CHill032

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: First, the tracking of this litter sucks. But not.enough to remove a star. I have paired this litter with my Lotter Robot and hot damn if my home doesn't smell like cats! I'm pretty sure this bag will last me 2 months with box cleaning on every use plus the insane clumping power of this litter. The price threw me off originally but now that I know it will last me twice as long, it even out to be about the same per month.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie F

customer_reviews.title: Tracks way to much.
customer_reviews.text: Does a good job with low dust but is very gummy and hard to scrap up when litter is low. That’s ok but it tracks really badly and that’s a deal breaker. I tracked it under my sheets without realizing in and it was all over my bed. Too bad because it’s a good litter otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Josie

customer_reviews.title: Not too bad
customer_reviews.text: I had been using the "best" litter for a while and decided to give this one a shot as I was worried the other brand might be bothering my kitty (it wasn't). This litter isn't bad, but it doesn't clump as well as the other stuff I was using. Also, my cat tended to track this one a lot more. It still did its job and it's a bonus it's natural and doesn't have the terrible aroma of clay. I would buy it again but it for the price it would not be my first option.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: So right by kitty
customer_reviews.text: I will never buy crystals or clay litter, they are bad for kitty and for the earth. I will only buy organic, natural litter and I have been using the kind made brim walnut shells. Works great...is heavy and I wanted to try something new. This litter is GREAT! My cattos love it and it’s gentle on their delicate toes, clumps great and weighs nothing. I’m a fan and now I’m on auto ship. The health of my babies is everything, I’m a big fan of this litter.
customer_reviews.author: Monya

customer_reviews.title: Great litter. My cat was exposed to toxic mold ...
customer_reviews.text: Great litter. My cat was exposed to toxic mold so he now has sensitivities. Wheat and corn products are to be avoided because of mycotoxins. Most clay litters have silica which is bad for cats. Was glad to find this all natural product. Does track some, since its light weight. A good litter mat from Amazon should help with that. Easy to use since you can throw urine balls and poop right down the toilet.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph T.

customer_reviews.title: Best Cat Litter on the Market
customer_reviews.text: I tried many different cat litters over the years and this one is by far the best! I hate the smell and dust that kicks up when you are cleaning out the cat litter from other brands. They smell like chemicals. However, with this brand, it smells all natural. I don't feel like I am breathing in all the dust that comes from other cat litters. I can go for up to four weeks without changing out the entire litter. I am very happy with this product. The only slight sownside is that it does create a small mess around the litter box, but is easily picked up by a small hand held vacumn.
customer_reviews.author: LM

customer_reviews.title: Super light weight and dust free
customer_reviews.text: I'm trying this litter for the first time. I have to say I really like it. I'm not sure yet if both my boys like it. My one boy who's not picky at all has been using it without any issues. I've yet to see my other boy use it. This litter is extremely light weight with no dust or strange odor. It does clump extremely well. It does track a lot though. I'm going to try to put less in the box to see if that makes a difference. I hope both my boys end up liking this litter since I really do! I ordered cat attract to help get my other boy used to this litter.
customer_reviews.author: bookwormTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect...
customer_reviews.text: Almost perfect! I love the lack of stench... I abhor the smell of the general cat litter at box stores. Blegh. This one has little to no smell. If I forget to scoop for a day or two then it smells a little like feces, but it's so much better than the funky perfume clay crap! It's almost perfect, but the clumping isn't too great at times. Not sure why some pee doesn't clump as well as others... But sometimes it'll kind of fall apart when I scoop it. Maybe I have too little or too much in the pan? Idk, I'll figure it out some day...
customer_reviews.author: Serah

customer_reviews.title: Best litter for someone allergic to litter
customer_reviews.text: I’m super allergic to normal cat litter and the wood pellet ones I typically use don’t clump at all so that means I go through a bag really quickly. I ordered this because it came in a small bag and i was traveling with my cat. It works so much better than I expected. Even in a small hotel room this litter did a good job of absorbing smells and it clumps well so it’s easy to clean. Also the granules are large enough they it’s easy to sweep up when my cat kicks it out of the litter tray.
customer_reviews.author: Melody Watson

customer_reviews.title: Gets everywhere
customer_reviews.text: I tried this out as a dust free alternative for my asthmatic cat. It's great for being dust free, but it tracks everywhere. I had to keep a broom on hand and sweep several times a day. I've used many other litters, and this one takes the prize for getting everywhere. It also doesn't control the smell as much as I'd like, with this one I have to empty after every kitty poop or the family complains. I've switched to a different dust free and it's great to not have to sweep all day and to be able to just clean the box in the evening rather than having to do it whenever my cat does his business.
customer_reviews.author: Gloaming

customer_reviews.title: Love it so far!
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight? Yes. So much easier. Dusty? No. Clumps well? YES. And does not get stuck to the litter box! It's like a sponge. Smells clean? Best that I've tried. Tracking? Some. It's much less painful than crystals or clay. Cat likes it? Yes. (In fact, I think he thinks it's really fun to dig around in.) Two things: I wish it came in a cardboard box, for easier storage, but that is easy to remedy. And I wish it was a little cheaper. That said, a little of it seems to go a long way.
customer_reviews.author: SnooRay

customer_reviews.title: great smelling, light, dust free kitty litter
customer_reviews.text: I have been on a quest to find the perfect cat litter. While i havent finished the blog post on that topic yet, I have decided after trying 30 plus cat litters, that this litter is one of my top three. the cats love it, it is lighter and healthier for the environment. Being that I talk to cats on a weekly if not daily basis about peeing issues, I know what cats love & what they don't. This litter is a winner is my 5 cats conclusions. I whole heartedly recommend this litter!
customer_reviews.author: Ann Hoff

customer_reviews.title: Same as Foster & Smith grass litter
customer_reviews.text: I love grass litter and will never go back to Clay. This is the same as what I bought from Drs. Foster and Smith for years and feared I had lost it when they went out of business, purchased by Petco. This brand though is way overpriced and the same litter is sold for less under the So Phresh label at Petco and Chewy has another grass litter that is the same product.
customer_reviews.author: Seahorse

customer_reviews.title: Best litter I’ve ever used.
customer_reviews.text: This litter is awesome. One of my cats has allergies and the traditional clumping clay litter was not helping him in that aspect, way too much dust. This litter is all natural and really does clump well for urine and keeps the odor at a minimum if any at all. Well worth the extra cost for a natural option with great odor control. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonGirl817

customer_reviews.title: I feel good about this litter— it isn’t dusty
customer_reviews.text: My cat is an old lady and can’t clean herself as well as she used to, so we had to discontinue clay based litter. I feel good about this litter— it isn’t dusty, won’t hurt her if she eats any while grooming, and clumps! Not sticky clumps, but clumps that are actually easy to scoop. If you are looking for a natural litter that isn’t made of clay, this is worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: I liked it until this bag
customer_reviews.text: I liked this litter: it clumps decently, the smell is lighter than other "natural" litters, and it tracks less than what I've used before. However, the last 10 lbs. bag I opened was infested with insects! There were absolutely no holes or tears in the bag, so I assume that the litter was shipped contaminated. I'm disappointed with the company and frustrated with the fact that I'm going to have to search for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Vora

customer_reviews.title: Down with dust forever!
customer_reviews.text: Glad my daughter convinced me to try this litter! The lack of dust and the super clumping are the best features for me. The bag is strong, reseals well and stands up nicely, which are all kind of the icing on the cake. :)
customer_reviews.author: TopazVT

customer_reviews.title: Love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: Love this stuff! Have 3 cats. Used Fresh Step for years, but too dusty! Seemed to get worse over time. Tried Precious Cat cuz I think new cat has allergy to Fresh Step. Precious Cat better than fresh step, but still concrete bits all over. Smart Cat doesn't feel like concrete. No dust. Clumps great. Has a faint grain smell to it which is pleasant. Mixed it with others and did okay, but works significantly better by itself. Have 2 boxes, one still has mixture of 2 brands, the other is just Smart cat - the mixture box almost never gets used., Sign up for Subscribe and Save and it knocks a couple bucks off.
customer_reviews.author: Nscott

customer_reviews.title: BEST CAT LITTER EVER
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying I hate cat litter. I have tried several brands but Smart Cat is by far and away the best. It clumps WAY BETTER than other brands and does not stick to the bottom or sides of the litter box. I know other reviews have complained about it scattering too much but in my opinion all cat litter scatters. The positive features for me far outweigh the scattering. And my cats like it. A wonderful product. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rescue Cat Likes It!
customer_reviews.text: I've got a rescue cat that has an upper respiratory infection (URI) and thus was told by the Vet to not use dusty, clay litter on her and so I gave this litter a try and so far so good. My rescue cat seems to really like it and it doesn't produce the dust like the other brands I've been using. My only feedback is it does seems to stick to my rescue cats paws and track out of the litter box more so than the other brands I've been using.
customer_reviews.author: Kim B.

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE IF YOU HAVE DOGS
customer_reviews.text: I’m sorry to say I had to stop buying this liter. If I didn’t have dogs I would continue to use it, but because the way this liter clumps together when it gets wet can be very dangerous for dogs that can get access to cat boxes. 2 of my dogs almost chocked to death because that got to the liter box and ate some of the liter. Once it got it their mouth the moisture from their saliva turn the liter into a clay substance and got lodged in their throat. If you don’t have dogs, it’s the best liter.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Fox-Yoder

customer_reviews.title: World's (Actual) Best – great clumping litter for declawed cats
customer_reviews.text: This is hands down the best litter I've tried – much better than World's Best. My declawed cat prefers the softer texture of this to WB, and it clumps amazingly well. It doesn't do the best job of hiding smell sometimes, but I sprinkle with odor remover to help with that. It tracks a bit, but I haven't found litter yet where this wasn't a problem.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Surprised how much I like this litter
customer_reviews.text: I have one cat with CKD so he drinks a ton of water and pees a lot. With clay litter, I would have an enormous glob stuck to the side of the litter box. It was hard to clean every day. The urine absorbs differently with this litter and is much lighter in weight. I don't have the hard glob to clean. I really like the litter, but because I have 7 cats and it is pretty pricey, I only use it in 2 of my boxes.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Mertens

customer_reviews.title: Not sure what to think.
customer_reviews.text: I've slowly been going through more eco-friendly cat litter. I really like the grass seed litters. This one is okay. It clumps well but does nothing for the odor. My reason for giving it one star is that it had a bunch of styrofoam in it. One piece was nearly three inches wide. I'm not sure how on Earth styrofoam got into a sealed bag of cat litter.... But it was in there..... Very strange.
customer_reviews.author: Casices

customer_reviews.title: Better than clay
customer_reviews.text: My cat needed no acclimation time. Clumps well, with no dust. I'm happy to have found a litter that doesn't expose my pet to the nasty, dangerous chemicals/scents in most clay litters.
customer_reviews.author: jimi tarbox

customer_reviews.title: This stuff gets EVERYWHERE. Three weeks after I stopped ...
customer_reviews.text: This stuff gets EVERYWHERE. Three weeks after I stopped using it and I'm still finding it all over the house.
customer_reviews.author: Amy M

customer_reviews.title: Great litter!!
customer_reviews.text: I am so thrilled to have this litter. I like the reviews I read about it. It clumps so well and doesn't stick to the litter box. It is so light weight too. I like that it is safe for my cat and the environment. The clay litters I have used stuck to the pan and to my cat's feet and I hated that. This is so much better. I am on auto shipping and looking forward to this each month. It also hides the smell very well.
customer_reviews.author: DS Woods

customer_reviews.title: THIS STUFF IS THE BEST EVER!!!!
customer_reviews.text: With three cats, I've ever been in search of better litter. THIS IS IT! I will never, ever go back to Tidy Cat or Arm-N-Hammer. No smell whatsoever of urine or feces. I use plastic storage bins for litter boxes to keep my dogs out and, unlike other regular clumping litter, SmartCat DOES NOT stick to the sides! Yes, it tracks more than standard stuff, but you know what: buy a mat from LTD Commodities like I did and it catches it all off their paws.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money it's Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: On this stuff is amazing. I have a small apartment and I hate the smell of litter everywhere. I literally can't smell this stuff standing right next to it. Also no pee or poop smell ever!!! It clumps well and is easy to scoop. My cat is really good at covering everything so I don't know how well it would work otherwise, but for me it's totally worth the money because I don't have to change it out as often so it lasts longer.
customer_reviews.author: Baylee

customer_reviews.title: Best litter ever.
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that this is NOT clay. I deliberately left the litter box unclean for 3 days and could tell, in this short time, that the clumps are solid and the litter coats the fesces well. My cats had no problems changing over. NO odor. Now I can clean it every day and make sure my cats and I don't have to put up with the terrible odors from scented litters. It's more pricey than other litters, but well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: L. Catt

customer_reviews.title: My New Favorite Cat Litter
customer_reviews.text: This is a great, light weight clumping cat litter. It is pricey, but it does last much longer than other brands I've tried (and I've tried most). I agree with other reviewers that it does get tracked in the house more than many other brands, but mats help with this. I do not find the slight smell unpleasant at all. The litter itself smells a little butterscotchy. There are no added fragrances. If my cats bury their feces, it definitely controls odor (no litter can control odor if you have a cat that does not bury it's feces). It is not dusty.
customer_reviews.author: MaryB

customer_reviews.title: My cat and I love this litter.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best litter I have ever used! I'm so happy to have found this dust free natural product. It clumps better than clay. Has a great natural sweetgrass scent. Is good for my cat and the environment.
customer_reviews.author: ER

customer_reviews.title: If everything in life filled requirements like this stuff we'd have world peace & no disease !
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly long lasting, truly no dust even with prolonged use. Excellent clumping, NO ODORS ! 2 finickie cats, & 2 critical humans all happy with this litter. A year ago I would not have considered it due to cost, but after trying at least 6 different brands that CLAIM to be dust free this IS THE ONLY ONE THAT REALLY IS DUST FREE ! Add other benefits like # 1 in clumping, ZERO odors, minimal tracking compared to the corn &/or nut shell products, light weight, & efficient = 10lbs replaces 25 of the other stuff ! Well worth the cost !
customer_reviews.author: Mary A.

customer_reviews.title: Horrible smell.
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it's because my litter box is covered, but this litter smells AWFUL. My entire bathroom smells horrible. I've only had it for a week and I'm hunting for new litter. There's no way I can wait out this entire bag. It's a shame, because this litter does pull away from the side of the box better than the last litter I was using, and it's much more lightweight. If the smell weren't so awful, it would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Joni Newman

customer_reviews.title: Great for my automatic litter box
customer_reviews.text: I am using the Petsafe Simply Clean automatic litter box. This is the best litter for my automatic litter box that I have found, because the clumps are not brittle, so they won't break into tiny pieces. I'm a huge fan! The odor control is sufficient for my needs, and the tracking is not too bad (admittedly I have two litter mats). Update July 2017: It seems that SmartCat has addressed the (relatively minor) issue of the bags tearing at the seam and leaking litter. All the bags I've used in the last 8 months or so have not leaked whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: L.H.

customer_reviews.title: Best when mixed
customer_reviews.text: Clumps better than any litter I've ever used. That being said, it clumps too well for me. Frequently the very solid, odd shaped clumps will not fit into my Litter Locker. My cats are both long haired and this tracks almost as bad as the pine litter. Also I cannot stand the way that it smells. Before I tried SmartCat I used the walnut litter. I saw one reviewer mentioned they mixed both together and that has been my favorite solution. It dilutes the smell enough for me and really enhances the clumping ability of the walnut, but I can still break it up to fit in my Litter Locker.
customer_reviews.author: Gen

customer_reviews.title: This is an absolutely FANTASTIC litter! It is lightweight and with a pleasant ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an absolutely FANTASTIC litter! It is lightweight and with a pleasant natural odor. It absorbs and clumps well. It does not control the odor from feces as well as traditional clumping litter with chemical deodorizers, but it is dust free and much better for allergic people like me. I think this is also much better and healthy for your cat than traditional clumping litters. The only downside is that being lightweight, your cat will spread it all around when scratching if you have an open litter box (like I do). But it takes just a few seconds to vacuum around the box. I highly recommend this natural litter.
customer_reviews.author: C. Siracusa

customer_reviews.title: Best litter ever!
customer_reviews.text: My cat really likes this litter and so do I. It has no dust, no scent and is very lightweight. I am retired and home a lot, so I scoop it whenever I see he has left me a present. This probably doesn't need to be done but the hobbit is very fastidious and wont use a dirty box. It is so easy to scoop this litter. It doesnt turn to cement in the corners and requires no chiseling. I just had back surgery and with a long handled scooper and this litter, it is so much easier for me. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Adult Cats Don't Want it; Kittens Make a mess
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use for a finicky cat at an animal shelter and ended up using it with little kittens who didn't know any better. The adults cats wouldn't use it and it is super gross to clean up. Think thick gooey urine filled oatmeal stuck to the bottom of your breakfast bowl, not pleasant. Do not buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Duck Dodgers

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I switched from “World’s Best Cat Litter” to this. The old litter was so dusty and our cat tracked it all over the furniture (and I think licking off the corn dust gave him diarrhea). I switched to this since it claimed dust-free - and it really is! It does track more around his litter box since it’s much lighter, but that beats dealing with litter dust. Cheaper to buy larger bag direct from manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Halebopps

customer_reviews.title: Tracks.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this litter. I tried it for 6 months but am now switching. I've used World's Best multi cat for years but got the idea in my head that it could be effecting my diabetic cat since its corn? Any way this controls odor and clumps as well as any litter and am very very happy with those qualities BUT it tracks worse than any I've used.
customer_reviews.author: D. Tennant

customer_reviews.title: Most Excellent Litter!  Great Clumping!  Zero Dust!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best litter I have yet found. And I've had cats for over 20 years. There is ZERO dust with this stuff. And it clumps like no other litter. Just comes right off in one piece! It's a little more expensive, but I think it's worth it - for my cat and for me, so we don't have to breathe that crappy dust. And I don't have to clean it up. And I don't have to scrub the used litter off the pan.
customer_reviews.author: MaryA

customer_reviews.title: Best cat litter ever
customer_reviews.text: Love this litter. There is NO scent except when you clean the stuff out. Next to no dust and does get spread out some but a litter mat catches 90 percent of it. Does not stick to paws. Would not use anything else. It seems expensive but one bag lasts a month (completely change every two weeks).
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: Best kitty liter! Even with multiple cats!
customer_reviews.text: We have always had multiple cats in our home and have tried many different kitty liter including natural and organic as well. This is by far the best! Guests say you can't even smell the litter box! It's safer for th cats than other kinds and the cats love it! Clumping action works and I find it lasts longer than other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Steven S.

customer_reviews.title: The best Cat Litter Ever
customer_reviews.text: This cat litter does a good job absorbing #1 & #2, as well as odors. It's better than any of the cat litters I've tried over the years. It clumps really quickly and you can scoop it up minutes later. No mess. I do find that initially, it does not mask some of the smells, so I add Arm & Hammer baking soda
customer_reviews.author: ZIM

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love this litter
customer_reviews.text: We really wanted to love this litter. From a sustainability standpoint, and for the health of us and our cats, we gave this litter a good try. However, after a few weeks of use (with daily scooping), the pleasant grass smell got stinkier and stinkier. It simply doesn't hold up against odors and is much to expensive to have to dump the entire box every week or two.
customer_reviews.author: CSchwarz

customer_reviews.title: Great product but a bit pricey.
customer_reviews.text: This is the only litter our allergic cat tolerates. Unfortunately, because she is a heavy user of the litter box, I am not able to salvage the unclumped litter when I clean her box each week. Therefore, this has become a pricey solution.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen

customer_reviews.title: Never again
customer_reviews.text: After two years of using this litter, I received a bag with live ants in it. I noticed an occasional gnat (moth) before which I dealt with, but there is no way to deal with ANTS. The convenience of biodegradable litter is not worth live bugs. I may try another biodegradable litter if a new one comes out, but I did not have success with the corn husk (disintegrated), walnut shells (dusty ~ turned the cats paws colors), or pine (did not last). The grass seed litter tracks more than other litters that I have used, but I okay with that because it clumped well.
customer_reviews.author: kukkimon

customer_reviews.title: Great NO DUST NATURAL litter !
customer_reviews.text: Close enough to perfect! We have tried all kinds of litter for years and haven't found a good non clay litter until now! For once a claim of NO dust is true! Clumps urine great! Soft on paws! It does track and all litters track this is lightweight so tracks a little easier .We got a good jumbo litter trapper to fix that issue! We have two cats both went to it immediately , one cat with respiratory issues and this doesn't bother him or any of us for that matter! You can pour this in the box and no dust! We love it.
customer_reviews.author: H&M

customer_reviews.title: Works great except.......
customer_reviews.text: This cat litter works as far as clumping goes. It doesn't smell and my cat likes it. The problem is that it tracks everywhere and I am forced to vacuum everyday or else I have little parts of litter on my bare feet...its clean litter, but still. I have used other natural litter that doesn't do this so it is definitely this litter. It is really too bad but I think the grains are just too fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have had great success with clumping with this litter
customer_reviews.text: I read the other reviews. I have had great success with clumping with this litter. I've also not had any problems with odor, although I do add an activated charcoal product to help. I love that it isn't dusty like so many .I also think it stretches a little further since it's light weight. My cats took to it immediately, and I have five. My only complaint, and the reason I give it four instead of five stars, is that it is so ridiculously expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I just started to switch to this from using tidy cat clay litter for years. Wow! I was not expecting it to work as well as it does. It clumps great. And there has been no smell! The normal litter was supposed to be super Oder absorbing and 24/7 protection and definitely was not. This stuff works way better!
customer_reviews.author: imjes2cute

customer_reviews.title: Super expensive
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this litter. It does everything it says & I wish I could keep buying it. On the desc. it said 20 litres, instead it was 20 lbs. The pricing is prohibitive. NOT A GOOD DEAL especially if youve got more than one kitty. Remember this is stuff your cat does its business on & then gets thrown away! How much should you really pay for that generally speaking? The price of cat litter these days has nothing to do with economic realities.
customer_reviews.author: curly

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I recently switched to this litter and so far am very happy with it. It is significantly lighter than traditional clay litters which makes it easier to handle. It has a pretty neutral scent and does seem to clump better than clay. I also like that it is a natural product that is environmentally friendly. My cats seem to be okay with the change which is also a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: smain

customer_reviews.title: Very good dust-free litter
customer_reviews.text: So far this litter has been great. I wanted a dust-free litter for my daughters cat, who stays in her bedroom. I worried about the effects of breathing in clay-based litter dust. This works very well and has a pleasant, organic scent. You can wait at least 3 weeks between changing out the whole litter box if you scoop daily.
customer_reviews.author: Anne D.

customer_reviews.title: Better than clay but....
customer_reviews.text: I like this stuff but you have to be on top of scooping, and changing the litter regularly. It claims "no smell" but that is definitely not true. If you let it go too long it starts to smell like a barnyard. It's still 100% better and healthier than clay and synthetic materials though so I will just deal. It clumps really well too.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Your Cat Deserves This LItter!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product! Super absorbent and healthy for our furry friends. Commercial litter is full of deodorants and chemicals that are air borne issues as well as toxic when the cats lick their paws and eat the residue or worse, eat tiny pieces of litter stuck in their paws. No dust. Pleasant "oatmeal" like smell when wet. Lasts a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Evans, Wellness Integrity Wisdom

customer_reviews.title: Great litter - too expensive.
customer_reviews.text: Love this litter but not the price. Won't be buying it anymore because of cost....the trick for this litter is to use a flat spatula to loosen the clumps from the litterbox before scooping it. Super quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Clumps well!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best clumping litter I've found. The clumps really hold together. I think I am getting the box cleaner and using less litter. The clumps can be a little difficult to pry off the bottom of the litter box but I've heard you can spray with Pam and the clumps won't stick. It works pretty well at odor control as well.
customer_reviews.author: Reba Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Tracks everywhere!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this cat litter for several months and it has absolutely no smell with two cats using it! It also makes perfect scoopable clumps that don't fall apart. The downside is that this litter tracks all over the house. It's very light and sticks to my cats paws and ends up all over the place. If they would change the formula to something heavier it would be the perfect cat litter.
customer_reviews.author: BluePoodle

product_meta.title: SmartCat All Natural Clumping Litter
product_meta.description: Size:20 lb.Can SmartCat natural litter really out clump clay litters? yes! with the perfect combination of us farmed grasses, our all natural litter really does the job. Light in weight, but strong in performance it clumps so fast and hard that odors don't even have a chance to escape. You will love how lightweight it is and your kitty's will love that it is all natural with no fragrances. With SmartCat's all natural litter you really do get the best of both worlds.
feature_bullets: GMO-Free product, Fragrance-Free, 99% Dust Free, Chemical-Free, Biodegradable - Renewable

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
